Just got home from a wonderful lunch. I had the rib eye steak sandwich and we all shared the grilled veggie plate. Both were exceptionally good. The service too is helpful but not too much. I look forward to returning for a second meal.

We had read good things about this restaurant for quite some time. It was very reasonable and good but not as good as the reviews. Table were very crowded and noise level was high. Would like to try sitting outside. Desserts were quite good and bread was exceptional.

This was our first visit . Gathering of 6 to celebrate a birthday . The food, and service were above expectations . The wait staff was cheerful, helpful , attention to detail . The owner came to our table. Warm personality , informative . I would definitely go back .

this place has excellent service and delicious turkish food. BYOB so bring a bottle of wine with you!

The Istanbul Sofra is a nice addition to Regent Square. They serve good Middle Eastern dishes among them many appetizers and chicken kabobs. They also often have Middle Eastern entertainment on weekends like belly dancers and Turkish bands. Well worth the visit and reasonably priced

Our party of three enjoyed a wonderful meal here, thanks in part to the great suggestions and friendly service provided by Seda. The hummus is lemony, the bread is hot and charred. The atmosphere, service, and cuisine are all top notch. The owner/manager makes a point to visit each table personally, often multiple times, and is very friendly and affable. The menu is diverse, and the food excellent. I can't recommend Istanbul Sofra enough for a pleasant evening!

Love the outdoor dinning On a summer Night
Friendly Owner interaction.
I have been to Istanbul Turkey. Dinning here brings back great memories

We have eaten at this restaurant several times and have brought a friend along. Each time we ate, we had a very good meal which was not only delicious, but also reasonable in price.

This place delicious and authentic. Quality is top-notch, and selection is wonderful. Try any of the grilled meats.

review_list:
If you like breakfast food, Pamela's is the place for you. Large portions, thin unique pancakes and amazing omelets. Don't forget, their signature home fries. President Obama visited several times when he was in Pittsburgh.
Four locations: Mt. Lebanon, Strip District, Shadyside and Squirrel Hill.

Pancakes with crispy edges that cover your plate...what could be better? This (along with the Pamela's in Millvale) is one of the best places to have breakfast in Pittsburgh. Big portions and delicious food.

Everything here is magnificent, incredible, delicious. You'll thank me later. The wait is worth every second. 👧🏻🍳🍞

My son and his girlfriend took me here early Sunday morning and I loved it!! Pancakes are like crepes- I had blueberry crime cheese pancakes. They were heavenly. We also consumed chorizo and eggs. We were at the original in the Strip district.
Pricey but worth it

Pamela's Restaurants are located throughout the city. I've been to at least 3 of them, The Strip District-21st St, Mt Lebanon ( south hill suburb- West Liberty Ave) and Oakland. The pancakes here are large and crepe like- thin. They must have high heat on the griddle because they are always nicely browned/ caramelized and delicious. My favorite is the...

The Breakfast western omelet and the French toast was tremendous . The place was packed,(expected for a Sundaymorning),but were seated in less then 5 minutes. We being this busy are food too less then 10 minutes. the service was great

I know this place is a popular Pittsburgh breakfast spot, even our President went there, but I just don't get it. It is not that good. The food at Pamela's is delicious! We drive down to Pittsburgh just to have breakfast some weekends. The crepe pancakes so lovely with their crispy edges and I love the Chorzio sausage with potatoes and eggs. Don't miss having a lovely little breakfast at this quirky little place, I swear some of the pictures on the wall are my family.

when i hear people going off about deluca's i always step in and point out that Pamela's is MUCH better and a better deal ...

The "headwiches" are awesome - huge, tasty sandwiches. The homemade chips they serve with them are excellent as well. Very much a bar atmosphere but incredible food. They also have takeout if you call ahead. Parking can be tough, especially on a weekend night. This is my favorite place in Pittsburgh to grab a sandwich.

Stopped in for lunch. Food was large and pretty good. Chips tasted stale I'd grab a crunchy one here and there. Service was okay. Once a big party gets sat after you forget any attention. Will go back next time we visit.

Went with my family before the Pen's game. Never ordered anything I didn't like.They're appetizers, especially the mushrooms are the best. The sandwiches and dishes are good and enormous. I love their own brewed beer, some of the best.

I love this place. Been there a few times and the food is always awesome. They also have lambic! Everyone I bring there loves it too.

My husband and I went to Proper before a show. It was the best. We sat at the bar because of wait times. Everything we had was terrific! We will be going back in a heartbeat.

Hofbrauhaus is good for three things: Drinking beer along the Mon in the Beer Garten, drinking beer inside in the cafeteria style restaunaunt at picknick tables. and drinking beer while eating delicious German food including Schnitzel, soft pretzel, sausages, and of course, beer cheese. Just like being at Oktoberfest:/

Never cared much for German food until I tried it here. The beer selection is excellent, and served in large, and huge size. Loved the beer cheese - try it on a pretzel! Had the wiener schnitzel - it was great! Service was very good - with the restaurant staff in traditional German outfits. The only downside is lack of...

The service, (especially our waitress and the hostess and host), entertainment and cost here were all excellent!!!!!! Our food was very good (not the best we have ever eaten - but very good). We will certainly go here again in a heart beat the next we are visiting Pittsburgh!

My husband and I visited Pittsburgh on the first Wednesday of the month, which happens to be the monthly "Keg Tapping" at Hofbrauhaus, so we made an evening of it. Always a good choice for German food and great beer. Now they have a lunch buffet which includes soups and many other goodies! Has been described as "like the one in Munich but Pittsburgh Hofbrauhaus has a better view!" outdoor biergarten and patio/deck seating in the warmer seasons.

Went here with my wife and daughter. Absolutely great food, service, beer, and atmosphere. Had the pork schnitzel which was awesome. Great beer made right there. A little pricy but well worth the visit. Live German music all the time. I highly recommend this establishment for great food and s good time.

Not bad food for a chain restaurant. I lived in Germany for 6 years so nothing compares, but if you haven't been over there, this is a good place to taste. Great oompah band when I was there.

Food was fine, as was the service but #8; I don't think so?! For some reason the chef felt it was best to keep my tuna under a heat lamp while preparing my partner's meal. I was less than impressed.

Once you pull up to this building you will be so thankful and amazed by such beauty. Upon going inside you'll be thrilled beyond belief by every bit of the stunning archetecture. The food is great, drinks so special and delicious. You'll be thrilled to have visited.

This is my go to place whenever friends come into town. The beer is awesome, the food is really good, and the service is typically very good. This is truly one of my favorite places to eat, drink, and be merry in Pittsburgh. Plus ....turning a church into a brewery is sheer genius.

Tasteful remodel of a lovely church. Atmosphere worth the visit alone. But the craft beer and good food will bring you back and back again.

Went to Church Brew Works for dinner with clients last week. Made reservations for our party of 7 but not sure they were needed. This place is really cool. If you are looking for someplace relaxed, fun and different, check it out. If you are looking for a 5-star, fine culinary experience, look elsewhere. The food wasn't bad, but wasn't...

An old church transformed into a brew pub. Good place for dinner or after hours with friends. Great local beer and food. The vaulted ceilings and brewing vats in the sanctuary make for a unique atmosphere. If you want to worship beer, stop here..

Went with a large group for work and had food brought out in group style. Good food, friendly servers ... I just can't get past they are making beer in what used to be a church and still make it look like it was a church. It was a good experience though!

This place is a blast! Really good beer... The brewing equipment sits upon what used to be the altar. Excellent bar food. My favorite painting on the wall are the two cherubs toasting each other with beer glasses!

This is a great place for the beer love, but also good for everyone. My husband had their beer sampler and enjoyed many of them. I don't drink, but loved the atmosphere and food. The traditional Perogies and malted ice cream was wonderful.

We went here for my boyfriend's birthday and it was amazing! The food was top notch! We started with bruschetta and then I had the wagyu steak and it was delicious. Even on a Wednesday morning with hardly any students in town, the Shadyside location of Pamela's was busy! That just goes to show how much of a neighborhood mainstay Pamela's is. The food is inexpensive and good, and the service is efficient. If you go on a weekend, expect to wait!!!

They serve food from cultures that have been in conflict with the US. Food used to help create understanding between cultures, how cool is that? They were serving Cuban food the day we were there. It was fun to taste the flavors of a different culture!

This is my favorite place to eat when having my breaks in between classes. They allow people to try different cultures food and do an amazing job at it!!

The location is great, near University of Pittsburgh and Carnegie Natural History museum. The food was delicious, decent price with the proportion. Also, the watermelon lemonade was good too.
I really liked the idea of serving food from countries we're at war or conflict with. Neat idea. I wasn't a huge fan of the fake Obama speech.

Hot August Sunday, stopped for a snack (current theme is Cuban) and was impressed with tastiness of the food. Staff were very friendly and helped us choose. Was not as impressed with the loudspeaker broadcasting bits of propaganda (although it is the theme) they should stick to the cuisine for those "countries in conflict".

I wish they'd come to other cities in U.S. The Cuban cuisine was really authentic. The staff is very pleasant and enjoyed talking about the restaurant's idea and impacts in the community.

Not much to say that hasn't already been said. Food unifies people and cultures in a unique and delicious way. The staff here are fabulous and the food was amazing. If you're in the area, give them a go--you won't be disappointed.

Delicious food served with excellent explanations of countries in conflict and their cuisine. You must check out this place if visiting Pittsburgh! I promise you won't be disappointed.

Delicious ice creams and chocolate whipped cream in an old times atmosfere. Great place. Try the coffee ice cream.

Many types of fresh baked bread. Some free samples. Garlic butter spread can also be bought. If you like bread=this is your place-right next to Wholeys!

Everyone knows that Pamela's diner is one of - if not THE best diner in Pittsburgh. The pancakes are thin and buttery in the middle and crispy on the edges. The omelets outstanding.

Everytime family or friends come for a visit they request a visit to one of Pamela's diners. I have been to squirrel hill, strip district, shadyside and millvale all are consistently good.

review_list:
I discovered this place and have recommended it to many others. The original Mancini's bakery is open to the public and the're open 24x7. There's something special about bread, pepperoni rolls, cinnamon bread, and many other products fresh from the oven. Of course, the aroma is truly memorable.

Stop by when you are on the strip in Pittsburgh, it's worth it. I love the sun dried tomato and basil bread, the pesto bread is also marvelous. I recently discovered their jalapeno cheddar - I think it's my new favorite.

Any day is a Great day to visit .. Only closes for Sun. Take family or friends and go to the strip districtfor a great Treat. Sat is peperoni bread day. Try some different bread flavors here Enjoy the rolls and salt sticks

The best bread in the burgh. Tons of types of bread for all occasions and food. Great taste. Great place.

Locally owned and operated, you cannot go wrong when you bring Mancini's bread home from the grocery store or if you stop by their bakery. We especially like their Italian. Slap on some butter and you are in bread heaven.

Mancini's bread was the ONLY bread my dad would haave,even though we wrer raised in the city,it was still a must when we had the chance to grab a loaf when we moved to the country.It is awesome,the crust is superb,and the texture is perfect.They have added a lot of additional varieties in the last 100 years,but still the BEST!

A stop by Mancini's is a trip down memory lane for me. As kids my parents would stop by Mancini's on our way home from Sunday's with the grandparents. Grandma used to send us home with butter, knife, plates and napkins and we would get fresh out of the oven Mancini's bread....so delicious! To this day it sells out everywhere...

A hometown favorite for many years. There is none like it and it is the best Italian bread you will ever eat. A must buy whenever you're in the 'Burgh!

Mancini's is a long term Pittsburgh name synonymous with bread. Many local restaurants mention in their menus "Served on Mancini's bread". review_list:
Great live music playing singing typical Sinatra type songs. Bar was lively as was lobby of hotel Very modern interior. Great location near PPG Square and all the holiday activities. Drinks were good as was service.

Andys is located inside the Fairmont which is in a central location between Market Square and the Cultural District. They have a small bar and lounge area and it's a very nice atmostphere with an even nicer wine selection!

As you might expect, they have a lot of wine choices at very reasonable prices. The food is the surprise. I had the salt and pepper wings. I'm somewhat of a "chili head" and like my wings very spicy. They offered 4 separate spices for me to try at the table but after eating the wings with no spice, I...


More  



It's a nice enough bar but not fitting for such a dramatic lobby and hotel like Fairmont. This bar should be twice the size and serve food until closing. More  



Good service in a unique hotel lobby. Frequently has small musical groups on weekends. Seating available both at the bar and along the one side of the lobby.

We went to Andy's with another couple prior to a show in the lobby. The decor is beautiful and contemporary! Comfortable seating, prompt service. Wine specials for happy hour are the best deal on their wine ($5). The grilled veggie wraps with goat cheese are literally incredible!!!!! See pic I uploaded of it. Great ambience! Some celebrity sightings here, too!!

This bar is so perfect. It is romantic, fun, casual yet sophisticated. Not your typical hotel bar. My husband and I purposely come out of the way to get here. The live music is always great.
Tip: a seat at the bar gets you the best service

Andy's is a terrific place to sit down and relax. If that involves food, you'll be satisfied. If that involves drinks, you'll be especially satisfied--their drink menu is impressive and experimental. Cheers to that!
My husband and I loved the big blue couches near the windows, and our server was helpful and kind. This is definitely a classy place, and...

the bar itself is great but the staff is lacking. Overall we really enjoy Andys and always have cocktails there when we visit.

The bartenders are EXCELLENT mixologists. I told them I wanted something not too "alcohol-tasting" but like a flavored martini. She mixed up a raspberry martini and I couldn't taste the vodka. The bar had a jazz band on the weekend we were there. Great music.
title: Andys Wine Bar, Pittsburgh

We visit Pittsburgh several times per year, and have a meal at Aladdins as part of most visits. My wife and I each always get one of their sampler meals (humus, felafel, chicken, beef, salad, pita). Delicious food, good service, very reasonably priced.

We were in town for the vegan festival and visited this place. The menu has everything labeled so opit makes ordering very easy. The portions is great and the service was also good. You can order an appetizer and two dishes for under $35. The vegan dished we had were whole foods and freshly prepared.

We came bigger group for lunch. we ordered few things. Restaurant looks nice and cakes looks great but we didn't order it.
Food like pitzas and pitas are really cheap and pretty good. Next time i will take sth from specialties.

I love Indian-style food and this place is great for it! One of the only places in Squirrel Hill my friends can all agree on. Lots of vegetarian options too! A lot of the options are healthy as well.

With a vast & assorted menu, there is something for everyone. The location is convenient and the parking is free. The prices are reasonable. The staff is pleasant & helpful. Most significantly, the food is delicious!

My colleagues and I dined at Hough's after an outing at Escape Room Pittsburgh (next door). Hadn't heard anything about it...other than that it was close to our outing. My family and I enjoyed many delicious beers at Hough's Bar and Restaurant while brewing beer at Copper Kettle Brewing. Hough's has an amazing selection of every kind of beer. We already have plans to return. The wait staff was attentive and friendly and we really enjoyed the food. There's something at Hough's for everyone!

Took a business colleague here on a recent Sunday afternoon. They have many beers on tap and many more bottles. I ordered the Rueben and it was good. They smoke their own meats, so the food is not the same as any restaurant. It is better.

Huge selection of beer, great food menu, and if you want....brew your own beer next door in their brewery, Copper Kettle! If you haven't visited, this is a fantastic place, especially for happy hour! Parking is a bit tricky sometimes, but worth the stop! 😊👍

Went there with my son, his fiancé and their friends. Good foo. Good beer. Pleasant people. Nice neighborhood bar. Give this place a try you won't be disappointed.

The Tap Room is great on nights when there isn't a hockey game. On those nights it's slammed packed. The food is good. The grilled chicken on olive bread is a personal favorite. The homemade chips are also really good.

Maybe just a bit on the small side for the amount of people an event brings to the city but it makes up for it in quaintness and service.

We stayed in the hotel and had lunch there. Food was typical pub fair. The nachos and wings are a must have. Staff was very nice and friendly.

We just arrived in Pitt for New Years Eve & decided to grab something in our hotel. It was delicious and the environment was warm & friendly. I recommend the crab cakes with shallot cream sauce paired with the Kris Artist Cuvée Pinot Grigio.

Great late night stop on way back to hotel. Inside the hotel it's a typical Irish, dark wood, dark, lots of beer, but good wine, good food with local Pittsburgh eats.

After a class upstairs my co-worker and decided to eat here instead of the larger restaurant in the hotel. Though I'm sure the food comes from the same kitchen.

review_list:
We went once and thought it was poor but worthy of a second chance. We went a second time and it was even worse. Our mistake! Soggy flavorless pizzas. Must better within walking distance.

A nice, quick place to eat if staying at the nearby Wyndham Grand. There is additional parking in a nearby garage too. Good menu variety and service!

Delicious, fresh, convenient and friendly! Pizzas were fantastic and ceasar salad was perfection. Reasonably priced and the casual dining room was furnished with fun artwork, cool industrial tables and chairs surrounded by stacks of real fire wood for the woodfired oven. Cool place!

Thin crust pizzas with a nice variety of toppings. I tried the Bianca al prosciutto with arugula and shaved reggiano. The crust was thin and not overdone. Just the right amount of garlic, no tomato sauce. My friend had the turkey and cheese with all the toppings on fresh warm bread. Outdoor seating. Inexpensive and close the Wyndham Grand.

Nice and convenient location, fresh ingredients, simple and quick. Vegetarian options and custom orders are possible. It was the only place close by that was open after 9pm and it was a pleasant find.

Enjoyed this pizza place for the first time while in town for a convention. The location was great as it was right across the street from our Wyndham Grand Hotel. The service was fast and friendly and my order did not take long at all. I would DEF go back to try another Flavor of pizza.

Good Pizza. A little smaller inside than I expected. Extremely helpful and friendly workers. I wish my wife had been along on that trip, as I believe she really would have liked the wood oven pizza, as it had a crispy crust. A very reasonably priced product, which I appreciated staying at the Grand Wyndham.

Really great, thin crust pizza. We got a couple of pizzas to go and ate them outside of our hotel on the patio. The prices are very reasonable and it is great if you love the New York Style, thin crust pizza!

Wonderful fancy pizza in Pittsburgh--we used to go all the time when we lived there. Fun appetizers and salads. One of the restaurants we miss since we moved.

Visited Dinette with my wife based on the recommendation of a friend. We enjoyed excellent appetizers, and a really good pizza....perhaps one of the best in Pittsburgh. They had a nice wine list, reasonably priced. Service was good. Restaurant was simply finished, a bit loud. All in all, we will absolutely return.

If you want a simple, creative well made mea,l with fresh ingredients that won't break the bank this is a great choice. The atmosphere is stark and small but warm in a modern cozy way.

My girlfriend and i went to dinette for dinner last night. She has been wanting to go door some time now. The place is interesting it has a very modern atmosphere and is in a strip mall type area. A+pizza! Lots of flavor and unique pizza combinations, wood fire, fresh ingredients, my rating would be 5 if I were only rating the pizza.
The atmosphere could be a positive for some, but a negative for me, personal preference. It is clean but very very small, crowded, and noisy. You are eating practically next to other guests, trendy vibe.

This is a neighbourhood place and not easily accessible from downtown.

A favorite of many locals, the focus is truly Pan-Asian: from Chinese to sushi to Thai. Room for big parties or small with plenty of parking. We got a take out lunch and ate outside on a glorious, sunny fall day. Red curry was the very best. Good value.

Hadn't been to Plum in a long time. A rainy night in Pittsburgh dictated a place you could park in shelter. Plum was the ticket. The pizza is rather unique in that they slice it into squares. I have never had a bad one from here. The staff is very courteous and friendly, as well as helpful.

Visited for the first time tonight and was very pleased. Sir Pizza isn't that truly awesome pizza that you'll always remember; it's that pretty-good pizza that you'll keep coming back to get because of fast, friendly service and consistent quality. This is good, working-man's pizza, hearty and fresh. Definitely will try it again!

The dining room over time has expanded and is now a very comfortable place for seated dining. However, there are a lot of Dad's who pick-up pizzas to go and grab a draft.
The Beef Boat sandwich is a hidden gem on the menu, and the spaghetti is another item that I really like.

I used to go to the Cranberry for lunch. It was always good too. It is nice inside. The pizza and breads ticks were great.

Sir Pizza tends to be a unique pizza-you either love it or hate it. I do believe the first time I tried a pepperoni, didn't feel the love. Fresh wonderful ingredients - unique pie with toppings to the edge; and cut in squares. Our typical is the large pepperoni and sausage. It is a heavy pie and will stick with you awhile - we usually get carryout. Rather tough area to get in and out of on the w-end. Friendly service is a plus.

This used to be a good family run Italian restaurant. Nothing out of the ordinary - but ok. Then the grand-kids took over and the quality went below bad.
It has remained an empty storefront for months. I just drove by (July 2015) and nothing changed.

What does it take to have a good Italian restaurant? Good bread, good sauce, good pasta and good prices. Del's has them all. Nothing fancy just good food and large portions.

The luncheon buffet isn't a bad deal, if you are looking for quantity, instead of quality. Actually, the salad bowl had pretty good, with homemade dressings. The pasta sauce could have been fresher and the pizza was, probably, the worst I've ever tasted. I won't even discuss the disguised green beans or the cannoli.

I can recall the EXTRA SPECIAL treat it was to have a Sunday dinner at Del's. Not that I expected Robert Irvine to be able to help, but for them to essentially throw his entire menu out the window shows that the owners clearly don't care anymore.
